docs.snippet: Federal crash investigators are heading to Philadelphia a day after a collision between two trolley cars injured nearly 50 people....
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal crash investigators are heading to Philadelphia a day after a collision between two trolley cars injured nearly 50 people.

headline.main: NTSB to Probe Philadelphia Trolley Crash That Hurt Nearly 50
headline.print_headline: NTSB to Probe Philadelphia Trolley Crash That Hurt Nearly 50

docs.snippet: Bakary Sako was included in Mali's 23-man squad for the African Nations Cup finals on Thursday after appearing in his first club match for a month when he came on as a substitute for Crystal Palace this week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bakary Sako was included in Mali's 23-man squad for the African Nations Cup finals on Thursday after appearing in his first club match for a month when he came on as a substitute for Crystal Palace this week.

headline.main: Sako's Palace Cameo Helps Secure Place at Nations Cup
headline.print_headline: Sako's Palace Cameo Helps Secure Place at Nations Cup

docs.snippet: 2016 was a good year for movies — not from major studios — exploring race and class....
docs.lead_paragraph: 2016 was a good year for movies — not from major studios — exploring race and class.

headline.main: Watching While White: How Movies Tackled Race and Class in 2016

byline.original: By A.O. SCOTT and MANOHLA DARGIS

docs.snippet: One suspect was killed and three others arrested in a police raid in connection with a bomb attack that killed six policemen in Cairo on Dec. 9, the Interior Ministry said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: One suspect was killed and three others arrested in a police raid in connection with a bomb attack that killed six policemen in Cairo on Dec. 9, the Interior Ministry said on Thursday.

headline.main: One Dead, Three Held in Connection With Cairo Bomb Attack
headline.print_headline: One Dead, Three Held in Connection With Cairo Bomb Attack

docs.snippet: The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) said Thursday it will investigate the collision of two trolleys in Philadelphia that injured 46 people and sent 25 to the hospital....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) said Thursday it will investigate the collision of two trolleys in Philadelphia that injured 46 people and sent 25 to the hospital.

docs.snippet: The Times offered $100 to the reader who could write a better motto than, “All the News That’s Fit to Print,” then decided that no one could....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Times offered $100 to the reader who could write a better motto than, “All the News That’s Fit to Print,” then decided that no one could.

docs.snippet: Turkish Deputy Prime Minister Veysi Kaynak said a much larger attack was apparently being planned, based on the weapons found at the scene of a car bombing in the western city of Izmir on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkish Deputy Prime Minister Veysi Kaynak said a much larger attack was apparently being planned, based on the weapons found at the scene of a car bombing in the western city of Izmir on Thursday.

headline.main: Weapons Found in Izmir Suggest Larger Attack Planned: Turkish Deputy PM
headline.print_headline: Weapons Found in Izmir Suggest Larger Attack Planned: Turkish Deputy PM

docs.snippet: A U.S. jury in Ohio ordered DuPont on Thursday to pay $10.5 million in punitive damages to a man who said he developed testicular cancer from exposure to a toxic chemical leaked from a Dupont plant, the plaintiff's lawyer Robert Bilott said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. jury in Ohio ordered DuPont on Thursday to pay $10.5 million in punitive damages to a man who said he developed testicular cancer from exposure to a toxic chemical leaked from a Dupont plant, the plaintiff's lawyer Robert Bilott said.

headline.main: Jury Orders DuPont to Pay $10.5 Million Over Leaked Chemical
headline.print_headline: Jury Orders DuPont to Pay $10.5 Million Over Leaked Chemical

docs.snippet: A son of late al-Qaeda head Osama bin Laden and a leader of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula were added to the U.S. counter-terrorism blacklist on Thursday, a move to keep them from using the U.S. financial system, the State Department said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A son of late al-Qaeda head Osama bin Laden and a leader of Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula were added to the U.S. counter-terrorism blacklist on Thursday, a move to keep them from using the U.S. financial system, the State Department said.

headline.main: Bin Laden Son, AQAP Leader Added to U.S. Terror Blacklist: State Department
headline.print_headline: Bin Laden Son, AQAP Leader Added to U.S. Terror Blacklist: State Department
